intro: Psoralea ivumba, commonly known as the mountain psoralea, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Psoralea ivumba is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, where it plays a minor but ecologically significant role in local biodiversity.
